page.title: 14Farming
page.content: This area is mainly rich rolling down- land of N.E Hampshire. Part of large estates or farms with large fields in- tensively managed for cereals or grass with cattle and sheep winter grazing. 3 sq kms woodland to the south. No complete farm within block. Most land Manor Farm,part of Hoddington Estate. Hale Farm only farm actually lived in by old family tenant farmer, Earwaker, who also farms Weston Corbett land. Area partly Lee Farm,Mr.Dunford. Swainshill Farm,now run by Mr.Porter of New Farm S.Warnborough.Park Farm and S.Warnborough Farm,Mr Butler. Weston Common mostly Foresty Commision Crops:approx 1176 acres barley and wheat.4 acres oats. 268 acres pasture and 2 year lays for grazing,Silage and hay. 150 milking cows,125 store cattle over wintered,1280 lambing ewes,3 working dogs,assorted cats,1 ferret !
